doc.after: Bradman's name has become an archetypal name for outstanding excellence, both within cricket and in the wider world. The term Bradmanesque has been coined and is used both within and without cricketing circles.[207] Steve Waugh described Sri Lankan Muttiah Muralitharan as "the Don Bradman of bowling",[208] while John Howard, former Prime Minister of Australia, was called "the Don Bradman of politics" by his Liberal Party colleague Joe Hockey.[209]
